data.title: Good multi-purpose venue
data.text: Liberty Hall is in the heart of the action on Massachusetts St and offers a variety of activities from live shows to old movies.  Nice place for an outing.

data.title: A richly renovated throwback theater reminiscent of the early part of the 1920's.
data.text: The Free State Festival held annually in Lawrence, Kansas, sponsored  a concert and question and answer session with Kris Kristofferson on his 80th birthday. A screening of one of his films was held late afternoon in the renovated theater/cinema, which was then turned into a sit-down concert hall for this occasion. Liberty Hall is a wonderful gem, in the middle of America.  We drove 1472 miles to get to Liberty Hall and it was well worth the trip. The history in this town is varied, unique, rich and folks are friendly and accommodating.

data.title: Concert
data.text: Great venue!  Very intimate experience, not a bad place to watch in the whole place.  Ceiling is cool as well. Get there early to get a good seat on the balcony as its all GA.  You have standing room on the lower level and seats on a balcony on second level

data.title: Unique Movie Experience
data.text: I attended a viewing of an Indie film, "The Lady in the Van" at this facility last week.  It is a theater in a very old building, but the seating was comfortable. Pop and water were available as was candy and popcorn. They don't mind if you bring in a cup of coffee from the coffee house next door.  Overall a fun experience. Check their website for movies being shown and show times. The Little Theater is on the second floor, and there is no elevator in the building. I think there were about 15 or more stairs to the second floor.

data.title: Liberty Hall - Lawrence KS
data.text:
I went to see Arlo Guthrie at Liberty Hall in February of 2016.  The (over two hour) concert was great fun and I enjoyed it very much..  

Liberty Hall is certainly a historical treasure, however it really needs some help.  Lots of wall damage is visible, the floors need to be refinished, and there is obvious neglect to multiple areas of the entire building.  

I was fortunate to sit on a comfortable newer metal chair, but some are questionable wooden folding chairs that would have been miserable and uncomfortable for an entire concert.

If you are handicapped, note that the bathrooms are UPSTAIRS..

I did truly appreciate the coolers at the back of the auditorium that contained ice water.  A nice touch.. Thank You Management.

data.title: Where the good movies are
data.text:
Liberty Hall is in downtown Lawrence, where it was originally the town Opera House back in the 1800s. 
It is the only place in town where you can see first class movies. Here is were you see indie films, foreign films, and other cinema that doesn't come to the standard chain movie theaters. 
The are two screens. The upstairs screen is a standard small screen, but the main hall has a large screen in a full theater setting. 
In addition, Liberty Hall also has concerts about once a week in the main hall.
The snack bar serves beer and wine and snacks.
During the basketball season, KU basketball away games are occasionally shown in the main theater for free.

data.title: Best Popcorn in Town!
data.text:
Whether you're checking out the latest indie/semi-indie film or attending a local event, Liberty Hall is a fun place to spend an evening. 
We've seen two movies, two concerts, a live recording of a radio show, and decorated Christmas trees at Liberty Hall - all events have great service, are in a fantastic atmosphere (check out the ceiling in the smaller theater!), and hands down, they have the best popcorn in town!

data.title: "As You Wish..." for Valentine's Day
data.text: My dear hubby and I enjoyed a Valentine's Day showing of that wonderful love story, "Princess Bride."  Neither of us had ever seen it on the big screen and it was such a fun experience to share with other movie-goers.  The balcony was full of folks who were ready for a little nostalgia with this classic adventure, drama, love story and comedy. We cheered when Billy Crystal came on screen and booed at Prince Humperdink many times.  We all quoted those famous lines right along with Inigo Montoya and Fezzick and laughed at that ridiculous priest's voice.  We still gasped when we saw the ROUS's, even though we knew it was coming.  It was just so much fun.  The Liberty Hall is a fantastic old theatre and if you haven't had the chance to see a movie here, it should be on your must-do list.  Thanks Liberty, for such a fun Valentine's Day memory!

data.title: Historic theatre featuring independent films
data.text: This iconic theatre/event center is a Lawrence gem located in historic downtown Lawrence. It is a throwback to an older time. The facade is restored to its original luster. The theatres show independent films. The concessions offer real buttered popcorn and beer, yes beer, from the brewery next door. Also, don't exoect the newer theatre seating. The larger theatre is a popular venue for bands, and public and private events.

data.title: Intimate and fun venue
data.text: This is a great venue in which to see a performance. We we seated in the balcony and I doubt there's a "bad" seat in the house. The seats are small and the leg room is pretty non-existent, that's the only drawback.

data.title: Love this eclectic Theater!
data.text: This is a great theater that provide movies and shows that you just can't get anywhere else in the area.  They have the main theater and the "little" theater.  You can sit in a regular theater seat in the main theater or at tables and chairs that area set up on the main floor in front of the screen.  They have the usual popcorn, candy, sodas, etc. but my husband loves that he can get a beer while watching the show.  It's a really old building but it's got great ambiance and a real treat to visit.

data.title: Great Movie Theater!!
data.text: I have never been to a concert at Liberty Hall or rented a movie there, but I love to see movies in their theater! The building is old and beautiful, the movies are independent or foreign usually, but they also bring back classics and cult classics that are very fun! The prices are reasonable, the concessions are good. The popcorn is real and so is the butter. There is also a variety of healthier drinks and alcohols for sale. Both theaters are painted ornately, which makes for a very beautiful environment, much more special than going to a chain movie theater. One of my favorite things is that you can bring back your ticket stub within 30 days for $2 off a new movie ticket! Following them on Facebook or Twitter will also clue you in to the special movies they are playing. Since I began following them they have played: The Wizard of Oz, Beetlejuice, A Young Frankenstein, and Arsenic and Old Lace. -It's also the kind of place where people will clap after a movie. It's a wonderful experience, I highly recommend it!

data.title: Greatest of Lawrence Traditions
data.text:
Movies at the Hall, renting dvds, concerts... Liberty hall is one of the most vivid and crucial pillars of culture in lawrence.
If you live in lawrence, do not let this place scape your weekend choices. and you are visiting, go at least pay it a visit, try to catch a show or a movie (they serve beer!), or check out the dvd rental store.

data.title: Unique Theatre Venue
data.text: Liberty Hall is a very unique theatre venue in downtown Lawrence, Kansas.  It is located on the north end of Massachusetts Street in this fun college town.  Liberty Hall takes you back in time with some art deco design.  It is small, cozy, and inviting.  There is one large screening area for movies and a Little Theatre on the second floor.  Most films are art films and foreign films. I love the concession stand because it is the only theatre I know that serves teas and wines along with the traditional concession stand fare. Liberty Hall also hosts special concerts from time to time.  This is my favorite theatre for a good movie!

data.title: Beer and Popcorn
data.text: Classy and classic movies, cool interior design, staff teleported from the funky past, what else could you desire? And you can have beer and popcorn while you enjoy the flic. My kinda place!

data.title: Historic theater
data.text: I have been going to Liberty Hall for over 40 years. Historic theater. Have been to many different  kind of concerts here over the years. Has been beautifully restored. Thank you Lawrence for keeping this treasure for all to enjoy. Highly recommend.

data.title: Amazing venue for both music and film
data.text: Liberty Hall's a historical treasure of Lawrence - and a wonderful venue to boot. They have great shows and even better films coming through on a regular basis - only complaint of mine is the little theater isn't nearly as good of an experience as the large one in the auditorium if you're watching a movie. Otherwise, this is a real class establishment. Would recommend to anyone.

data.title: A Lawrence treasure
data.text:
What more can you ask of a local theater?  Shows the best movies that don't go to the big theaters. Community conscious.
Hosts many community activities and live shows.  Historically important. Neat place.  Sound system could be better.

data.title: Cool Alternative to a Traditional Movie Theater
data.text: Loved Liberty Hall!! We were in the little theater for a movie- such a great environment. It was a little cold and don't expect the comfy recliners at a traditional theater, but it was a great experience. Concessions are cheap and they even sell booze!

data.title: Have yet to find another....
data.text: Liberty Hall is the epitome of awesome, staff, shows, movies, etc. Great place to catch live bands, indie movies or a rental. The staff in the video department knows their stuff! Where other video stores have failed, I've always found what I'm looking for at Liberty Hall. LOVE the variety of snacks for the theaters.
